strapiPost.title: Northwest Arkansas’s Sales Tax Numbers Level Out In August Report
strapiPost.content:
After a record-setting July, Northwest Arkansas’s sales tax growth slowed to 5.4% in August, with the big four of the region bringing in a combined $9.712m in revenue.

August Numbers: Bentonville brought in $2.414m this August, up 10.54% from the prior year. Rogers reported $2.572m, a 4.52% increase over Aug 2022. Fayetteville reached $2.669m, showing a 5.54% rise over last year. Springdale grew 0.72%, with August sales tax revenue totaling $2.056m.

Optimistic Outlook: Across the eight months of reports for 2023, the four cities have collected a combined $75.182m, showing 10.77% growth over the same period last year. With several significant events like Bikes, Blues, & BBQ, College Football Season, and others increasing visitor numbers to the region in the coming months, leaders anticipate continued growth throughout the end of the year.
